title.narrative: India: National Vector Borne Disease Control & Polio Eradication Support Project

description.narrative: The National Vector Borne Disease Control and Polio Eradication Support Project (US$ 521 million) has four components, of which component four covers the cost of supplying oral polio vaccines (OPVs). The original Financing Agreement (FA) allows for the procurement of OPVs through agencies other than United Nation Children's Fund (UNICEF); however, the financial payment clauses in the FA do not allow for the payment of the cost of polio vaccine procured through suppliers other than UNICEF. The change is required to enable payment to agencies other than UNICEF who may procure OPVs under the project. It is also proposed to modify the disbursement arrangements for this operation along the following lines: a) the basis of documentation of the advance to UNICEF to be specified to include copies of their invoices for supply, along with proof of delivery, under cover of a withdrawal application approved by the Government (MOHFW); b) existing interim financial reports of the project (IUFRs) to separately indicate the amount of expenditure on vaccines procured from UNICEF; and c) for future procurement of vaccines from non-United Nation (UN) sources, the direct payment method will be applied if requested by MOHFW. For other cases, the normal disbursement methods could be applied, including advances through the designated account.

condition.narrative: Complete, not later than 6 months of project effectiveness, baseline surveys
Establish and retain financial management and procurement cells in NVBDCP
Finalize the design for impact evalution studies within 6 months of project effectiveness and start implementation of initial round
GOI will enter in to an agreement with UNICEF for provision of qulaity OPV in a timely manner

title.narrative: Long-lasting insecticide-treated malaria nets purchased and/or distributed (number)

comment.narrative: India started distributing the LLINs with this project
Total number of LLINS proposed to be purchased under the project
No further procurements have occurred since the previous period.

title.narrative: At least 50% of the sampled blocks which at baseline have not achieved the elimination goal of less than one kala azar case per 10,000 persons, will achieve elimination goal by endline

baseline.value: 236 blocks in 3 states (Bihar, Jharkhand, West Bengal) in 2010 reported to have annual incidence of greater than 1 per 10,000population (being confirmed by NVBDCP)

comment.narrative: This is a conservative estimate, based on cases reported from each block in 2010. Actual figures are likely to be several timeshigher, but more accurate estimates are not available from any source.

actual.value: Data currently being collated and analyzed.

comment.narrative: The assessment is currently in progress and is expected to be available prior to project closure.

title.narrative: Percentage of planned additional staff who are in position at central, state and district levels and received induction training.
Percentage of diagnosed kala azar cases completing the standard treatment as per the national guidelines.

actual.value: Data currently being collated and analyzed.

comment.narrative: The assessment is currently in progress and is expected to be available prior to project closure.

title.narrative: Percentage of facilities reporting no stock-outs of rapid disgnostic test for kala azar and first line medicines.

actual.value: Data currenly being collated and analyzed.

comment.narrative: The assessment is currently in progress and is expected to be available prior to project closure.

title.narrative: At least 80% of the households with eligible children covered during the national and sub-national immunization days in high risk districts

comment.narrative: *all activities and procurement under this component has been closed. This estimate is based on previous estimates. The goal ofpolio eradication has been achieved. Continuous monitoring and further activities are being carried on by the GoI through their ownfunds.

title.narrative: Percentage of designated providers of malaria diagnosis and treatment who have not had an ACT or RDT stockout during last 3 months.

baseline.value: 0% (ACT and RDK are being introduced under the project)

comment.narrative: No further assessments have been made since the previous one in March 2013. More recent LQAS data is likely to become available byproject closure, but the end-line survey is no longer feasible.

title.narrative: Percentage of Rapid Diagnostic Test (RDT) positive cases in project districts receiving Artemisinin-based Combination Therapy (ACT)no less than the day after the first contact

baseline.value: 0% (District-wide ACT introduction is being done under the project)

comment.narrative: No further assessments have been made since the previous one in March 2013. More recent LQAS data is likely to become available byproject closure, but the end-line survey is no longer feasible.

title.narrative: Porportion of eligible districts meeting the readiness criteria for each period of implementation.

baseline.value: 0% (These criteria are being applied under the project)

comment.narrative: Phase 1 districts during 2010 and phase 2 districts during 2012. 124 malaria endemic districts (50 phase 1 and 74 phase 2districts) and 46 kala azar endemic districts were declared ready.

title.narrative: The supply of oral polio vaccines for Supplemental Immunization Activities is sustained.

comment.narrative: **all procurement under this component has been closed. This estimate is based on previous estimates. The goal of polioeradication has been achieved. Further procurement is being carried on by the GoI through their own funds .

title.narrative: Percentage of individuals in project areas belonging to eligible Long Lasting Insecticidal Net (LLIN) target population who slept under an LLIN during the previous night

baseline.value: 0% (The Program has recently approved the policy for adopting LLINs)

comment.narrative: No further assessments have been made since the previous one in March 2013. More recent LQAS data is likely to become available byproject closure, but the end-line survey is no longer feasible.
Total number of staff to be trained in new treatment guidelines as well as the induction training for the new staff andinternational fellowships
Based on PIU reports. Staff attrition has been a problem resulting in a decrease in trained staff. Training for newly joinedstaff continues to be carried out.

title.narrative: Percentage of fever cases in project districts receiving a malaria test result no later than the day after the first contact

comment.narrative: No further assessments have been made since the previous one in March 2013. More recent LQAS data is likely to become available byproject closure, but the end-line survey is no longer feasible.
